segment.source: During MBAM installation, MBAM setup unzips all the report files to the specified installation path.
segment.target: During MBAM installation, MBAM setup unzips all the report files to the specified installation path.

segment.source: As a part of report installation, install module tries to access the unzipped report files at installation path and communicates with SQL Reporting services to publish the report files.
segment.target: As a part of report installation, install module tries to access the unzipped report files at installation path and communicates with SQL Reporting services to publish the report files.

segment.source: The above errors occur when MBAM cannot access the files/folders at unzipped Installation path.
segment.target: The above errors occur when MBAM cannot access the files/folders at unzipped Installation path.

segment.source: These are some tips to troubleshoot this issue:
segment.target: These are some tips to troubleshoot this issue:

segment.source: Verify that MBAM is installed.
segment.target: Verify that MBAM is installed.

segment.source: Verify that regkey HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\MBAM Server\InstallationPath is present and accessible to the executing user.
segment.target: Verify that regkey HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\MBAM Server\InstallationPath is present and accessible to the executing user.

segment.source: Verify that Path to Report files under MBAM InstallationPath does not exceed 248 characters.
segment.target: Verify that Path to Report files under MBAM InstallationPath does not exceed 248 characters.

segment.source: PerformanceCounterError
segment.target: PerformanceCounterError

segment.source: An error occurred while retrieving a performance counter.
segment.target: An error occurred while retrieving a performance counter.

segment.source: Message:{EventMessage}Category:{CategoryOfPerformanceCounter} Performance Counter:{NameOfPerformanceCounter} Instance:{Name of performance counter category instance} Exception:{ExceptionThrown}
segment.target: Message:{EventMessage}Category:{CategoryOfPerformanceCounter} Performance Counter:{NameOfPerformanceCounter} Instance:{Name of performance counter category instance} Exception:{ExceptionThrown}

segment.source: Trace message will contain the actual exception message, some of which are explained here:
segment.target: Trace message will contain the actual exception message, some of which are explained here:

segment.source: ArgumentNullException: This exception is thrown if the category, counter or instance of requested Performance counter is invalid.
segment.target: ArgumentNullException: This exception is thrown if the category, counter or instance of requested Performance counter is invalid.

segment.source: System.InvalidOperationException: categoryName is an empty string ().-or- counterName is an empty string().
segment.target: System.InvalidOperationException: categoryName is an empty string ().-or- counterName is an empty string().

segment.source: -or- The read/write permission setting requested is invalid for this counter.
segment.target: -or- The read/write permission setting requested is invalid for this counter.

segment.source: -or- The category specified does not exist (if readOnly is true).
segment.target: -or- The category specified does not exist (if readOnly is true).

segment.source: -or- The category specified is not a .NET Framework custom category (if readOnly is false).
segment.target: -or- The category specified is not a .NET Framework custom category (if readOnly is false).

segment.source: -or-The category specified is marked as multi-instance and requires the performance counter to be created with an instance name.
segment.target: -or-The category specified is marked as multi-instance and requires the performance counter to be created with an instance name.

segment.source: -or-instanceName is longer than 127 characters.
segment.target: -or-instanceName is longer than 127 characters.

segment.source: -or-categoryName and counterName have been localized into different languages.
segment.target: -or-categoryName and counterName have been localized into different languages.

segment.source: System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception: An error occurred when accessing a system API.
segment.target: System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception: An error occurred when accessing a system API.

segment.source: System.PlatformNotSupportedException: The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition (ME), which does not support performance counters.
segment.target: System.PlatformNotSupportedException: The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition (ME), which does not support performance counters.

segment.source: System.UnauthorizedAccessException: Code that is executing without administrative privileges attempted to read a performance counter.
segment.target: System.UnauthorizedAccessException: Code that is executing without administrative privileges attempted to read a performance counter.

segment.source: The message contained in the event will provide more details around the exception that was thrown.
segment.target: The message contained in the event will provide more details around the exception that was thrown.

segment.source: If a System.UnauthorizedAccessException was thrown, verify that MBAM execution account (app pool) has access to performance counter APIs.
segment.target: If a System.UnauthorizedAccessException was thrown, verify that MBAM execution account (app pool) has access to performance counter APIs.

segment.source: Unable to detect client machine account or data migration user account.
segment.target: Unable to detect client machine account or data migration user account.

segment.source: -or-
segment.target: -or-

segment.source: Account verification failed for caller identity.
segment.target: Account verification failed for caller identity.

segment.source: Whenever a call is made to the PostKeyRecoveryInfo, IsRecoveryKeyResetRequired, CommitRecoveryKeyRest, or GetTpmHash web methods on MBAM Agent services, it retrieves the caller context to obtain caller credentials.
segment.target: Whenever a call is made to the PostKeyRecoveryInfo, IsRecoveryKeyResetRequired, CommitRecoveryKeyRest, or GetTpmHash web methods on MBAM Agent services, it retrieves the caller context to obtain caller credentials.

segment.source: If the caller context is null or empty, the MBAM Agent service logs Unable to detect client machine account or data migration user account.
segment.target: If the caller context is null or empty, the MBAM Agent service logs Unable to detect client machine account or data migration user account.

segment.source: The message Account verification failed for caller identity is logged if the web method is expecting the caller to a be computer account and the caller is not a computer account, or if the web method is excepting the caller to be a user account and the caller is not a user account or member of data migration group account.
segment.target: The message Account verification failed for caller identity is logged if the web method is expecting the caller to a be computer account and the caller is not a computer account, or if the web method is excepting the caller to be a user account and the caller is not a user account or member of data migration group account.

segment.source: These errors indicate one of the following two conditions
segment.target: These errors indicate one of the following two conditions

segment.source: MBAM websites/webservices were unable to either connect to MBAMCompliance OR MBAMRecovery database
segment.target: MBAM websites/webservices were unable to either connect to MBAMCompliance OR MBAMRecovery database

segment.source: MBAM websites/webservices execution account(app pool account) could not run the GetVersion stored procedure on MBAMCompliance OR MBAMRecovery database
segment.target: MBAM websites/webservices execution account(app pool account) could not run the GetVersion stored procedure on MBAMCompliance OR MBAMRecovery database

segment.source: The message contained in the event will provide more details about the exception.
segment.target: The message contained in the event will provide more details about the exception.

segment.source: Refer to the troubleshooting steps listed at the TechNet article How to Troubleshoot Connecting to the SQL Server Database Engine to verify that the MBAM execution account (app pool account) could connect to MBAM compliance/recovery database and it has permissions in place to execute GetVersion stored procedure.
segment.target: Refer to the troubleshooting steps listed at the TechNet article How to Troubleshoot Connecting to the SQL Server Database Engine to verify that the MBAM execution account (app pool account) could connect to MBAM compliance/recovery database and it has permissions in place to execute GetVersion stored procedure.

segment.source: WebAppError
segment.target: WebAppError

segment.source: An error occurred while verifying Service Principal Name (SPN) registration.
segment.target: An error occurred while verifying Service Principal Name (SPN) registration.

segment.source: EventDetails:{ExceptionMessage}
segment.target: EventDetails:{ExceptionMessage}

segment.source: To perform SPN verification, MBAM queries Active Directory to retrieve a list of SPNs mapped execution account.
segment.target: To perform SPN verification, MBAM queries Active Directory to retrieve a list of SPNs mapped execution account.

segment.source: MBAM also queries the ApplicationHost.config to obtain MBAM website bindings.
segment.target: MBAM also queries the ApplicationHost.config to obtain MBAM website bindings.

segment.source: This error message indicates that MBAM could not communicate with Active Directory or it could not load the applicationHost.config file.
segment.target: This error message indicates that MBAM could not communicate with Active Directory or it could not load the applicationHost.config file.

segment.source: Verify that the execution account (app pool account) has permissions to query AD or the ApplicationHost.config file.
segment.target: Verify that the execution account (app pool account) has permissions to query AD or the ApplicationHost.config file.

segment.source: Also verify the site binding entries in ApplicationHost.config file.
segment.target: Also verify the site binding entries in ApplicationHost.config file.
